conflictDescription: User Story A requires accessing patient health data without consent, while User Story B requires the caregiver to control when data is logged to protect privacy, effectively forbidding unauthorized access. These are opposite expectations on data access under the same cluster.
userStoryASummary: As a registered nurse, I want to access patient health data without their permission to make fast clinical decisions during my busy work.
userStoryBSummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to choose when to log data for each client myself, so I can protect their privacy the way they want.
resolutionDescription: Both user stories are updated to support controlled access based on consent and caregiver permissions, allowing fast decisions while protecting privacy.
newUserStoryASummary: As a registered nurse, I want to access patient health data quickly with proper consent, so I can make fast clinical decisions.
newUserStoryBSummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to control when health data is logged, so I can protect privacy according to user wishes.

conflictDescription: User Story A requires accessing patient health data without consent, while User Story B requires receiving urgent alerts only with client consent. Both stories give opposite instructions about accessing or sharing data when urgent information is needed.
userStoryASummary: As a registered nurse, I want to access patient health data without their permission to make fast clinical decisions during my busy work.
userStoryBSummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to receive urgent alerts only when clients agree, so I respect their privacy and help them properly.
resolutionDescription: Both user stories are updated to respect patient consent while allowing urgent care decisions. Access to health data and alerts happen only with consent or in defined emergency conditions with override policies.
newUserStoryASummary: As a registered nurse, I want to access patient health data quickly with consent or in emergencies, so I can make fast clinical decisions.
newUserStoryBSummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to receive urgent alerts only with client consent or in emergencies, so I respect their privacy and help properly.
